benchmark_details.name: BIGG ENBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: BIGG ENBENCH is a principled generation benchmark designed to evaluate nine distinct capabilities of language models (LMs) across 77 diverse tasks with instance-specific evaluation criteria.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate language models' proficiency in a specific capability.

data.source: Crafted through a human-in-the-loop approach, validated by multiple annotators.
data.annotation: Annotated manually by annotators with expertise in the relevant field.

methodology.calculation: Correlation coefficients were computed to assess the relationship between responses from evaluator language models and human judgments.
methodology.interpretation: High values indicate strong correlation with human evaluators, reflecting reliability in assessment.
methodology.validation: Performance comparisons to human evaluators indicate strong correlations across different capabilities.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Instances were created through a human-in-the-loop process to ensure ethical considerations in data usage.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The BIGG ENBENCH is distributed under the CC-BY-SA license.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants were informed of potential risks and had the right to opt-out during studies.
